amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase the number of states eligible for funding through the nonmotorized National Priority Safety Program and to double the funding for that program.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 22 printed in Part B of House Report 114-325 to increase the number of states eligible for funding through the nonmotorized National Priority Safety Program, and double the funding for that program.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Blumenauer amendment (A022) Failed by voice vote.

action.text: Amendment (A022) offered by Mr. Blumenauer to the Rules amendment (A001).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Blumenauer amendment (A022) Failed by voice vote.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A022) offered by Mr. Blumenauer to the Rules amendment (A001).
